SENT.plain: Varicella zoster (VZ) is an unusual cause of CNS angiitis, usually occurring in older patients and immunocompromised hosts
The infection most commonly presents as herpes zoster ophthalmicus with contralateral hemiplegia
Mycotic aneurysm formation associated with VZ angiitis is rare
We report two cases of VZ angiitis with mycotic aneurysm formation (both aneurysms eventually ruptured) and one case of probable VZ angiitis with distal carotid occlusion and cerebral infarction
The CT and angiographic appearances, clinical course, and histopathology are presented
